00029 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00035 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00036  Initialises the VCOM port.
00037  Call this function before using VCOM_putchar or VCOM_getchar
00038  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00039 void VCOM_Init(void) {
00040 #if PORT_NUM
00041   CDC_Init (1);
00042 #else
00043   CDC_Init (0);
00044 #endif
00045 }
00046 
00047 
00048 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049   Reads character from serial port buffer and writes to USB buffer
00050  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00051 void VCOM_Serial2Usb(void) {
00052   static char serBuf [USB_CDC_BUFSIZE];
00053          int  numBytesRead, numAvailByte;
00054 
00055   ser_AvailChar (&numAvailByte);
00056   if (numAvailByte > 0) {
00057     if (CDC_DepInEmpty) {
00058       numBytesRead = ser_Read (&serBuf[0], &numAvailByte);
00059 
00060       CDC_DepInEmpty = 0;
00061           USB_WriteEP (CDC_DEP_IN, (unsigned char *)&serBuf[0], numBytesRead);
00062     }
00063   }
00064 
00065 }
00066 
00067 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00068   Reads character from USB buffer and writes to serial port buffer
00069  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00070 void VCOM_Usb2Serial(void) {
00071   static char serBuf [32];
00072          int  numBytesToRead, numBytesRead, numAvailByte;
00073 
00074   CDC_OutBufAvailChar (&numAvailByte);
00075   if (numAvailByte > 0) {
00076       numBytesToRead = numAvailByte > 32 ? 32 : numAvailByte;
00077       numBytesRead = CDC_RdOutBuf (&serBuf[0], &numBytesToRead);
00078 #if PORT_NUM
00079       ser_Write (1, &serBuf[0], &numBytesRead);
00080 #else
00081       ser_Write (0, &serBuf[0], &numBytesRead);
00082 #endif
00083   }
00084 
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089   checks the serial state and initiates notification
00090  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00091 void VCOM_CheckSerialState (void) {
00092          unsigned short temp;
00093   static unsigned short serialState;
00094 
00095   temp = CDC_GetSerialState();
00096   if (serialState != temp) {
00097      serialState = temp;
00098      CDC_NotificationIn();                  // send SERIAL_STATE notification
00099   }
00100 }
00101 
00102 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103   Main Program
00104  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00105 int main (void) {
00106 
00107   VCOM_Init();                              // VCOM Initialization
00108 
00109   USB_Init();                               // USB Initialization
00110   USB_Connect(TRUE);                        // USB Connect
00111 
00112   while (!USB_Configuration) ;              // wait until USB is configured
00113 
00114   while (1) {                               // Loop forever
00115     VCOM_Serial2Usb();                      // read serial port and initiate USB event
00116     VCOM_CheckSerialState();
00117         VCOM_Usb2Serial();
00118   } // end while
00119 } // end main ()
